intro: Ixora microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved flame bush, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of bright orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are highly fragrant and bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. Ixora microphylla is well adapted to tropical climates and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil.
